docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Coughlin, the editor of a small North Carolina paper, oversaw coverage that earned a Pulitzer Prize for public service in 1990.

headline.main: William Coughlin, 91, Editor, Dies; His Newspaper Exposed Fouled Water

docs.abstract: William J Coughlin, who after a career as a globe-trotting correspondent landed in a small North Carolina town where he led the local newspaper’s Pulitzer Prize-winning exposure of carcinogens in municipal drinking water, dies at age 91.
docs.snippet: Mr. Coughlin, the editor of a small North Carolina paper, oversaw coverage that earned a Pulitzer Prize for public service in 1990.

docs.lead_paragraph: Consumers seem to be willing to give up some choice in favor of lower prices, but critics, including opponents of the new health care law, are wary about narrowing networks.

headline.main: More Insured, but the Choices Are Narrowing
headline.print_headline: More Insured, but the Choices Are Narrowing

docs.abstract: Consumers seem to be willing to sacrifice some health care choices in favor of lower prices, but critics, including opponents of new health care law, are wary about narrowing networks, which feature limited groups of providers; insurers say narrower networks are essential to controlling costs and managing care.
docs.snippet: Consumers seem to be willing to give up some choice in favor of lower prices, but critics, including opponents of the new health care law, are wary about narrowing networks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Healthcare in Australia is set for its biggest shake-up since the introduction of universal coverage in the 1970s, as part of a tough federal budget on Tuesday that critics fret is taking the country towards a U.S.-style system.
